title: The cage /
author: Begbie, Harold
snippet: The man whose personality was easily the chief force in the Edinburgh of that day, and whose same as a consulting physician spread into foreign countries, lived in one of the grey houses in Darnaway  Street, wore threadbare broadcloth and a shabby hat, kept no carriage, employed but two servants, and allowed his wife fifty pounds a year for the clothes of herself, her mother and her child. This little family had porridge for breakfast, and dined in the middle of the day.
